(Ord. No. 90-41 § 1, 09-20-90) 
Section 14-111 - Reserved. 
Section 14-112 - Depositing handbills on uninhabited or vacant premises. 
No person shall throw, attach to the exterior of the building without owner's permission, or deposit any handbill in or upon any private premises which are temporarily or continuously uninhabited or vacant. For the purpose of this article, "temporarily uninhabited" or "temporarily vacant" means absent from the premises for 30 or more consecutive days. 
(Ord. No. 90-41 § 1, 09-20-90) 
Section 14-113 - Prohibiting distribution of handbills where properly posted. 
No person shall throw or deposit any handbill upon any private premises if requested by the occupant not to do so, or if there is placed on such premises in a conspicuous position near the entrance thereof a sign bearing the words "No Advertisement". 
(Ord. No. 90-41 § 1, 09-20-90) 
Section 14-114 - Distributing handbills at inhabited private premises; exemption. 
(A)  Distributing handbills at inhabited private premises. No person shall throw, deposit, or distribute any handbill in or upon private premises which are inhabited, except by handing or transmitting the handbill directly to the owner, occupant, or other person then present in or upon such private premises. In case of inhabited private premises which are not posted as provided in this article, such person, unless requested by the occupant of such premises not to do so, may place or deposit any such handbill in or upon such inhabited private premises if such handbill is so placed or deposited as to be reasonably secure and prevent such handbill from being blown about such premises or sidewalks, streets, or other public places under ordinary weather conditions, and except that mailboxes may not be so used when so prohibited by federal postal law or regulations. No person shall place on, deposit, or leave exposed in any private yard or driveway any unsolicited newspaper, handbill, or material after the owner or occupant has made a written request that same be stopped, which request is addressed to the publisher of the unsolicited material and which request identifies the name and address location of the owner or occupant who does not desire the material. 
(B)  Exemption for mail or newspaper. The provisions of this section shall not apply to the distribution of mail by the United States, nor to newspapers (as defined herein), except that newspapers shall be placed on private property in such a manner as to reasonably prevent their being carried or deposited by the elements upon any street, sidewalk, or other public place or upon private property under ordinary weather conditions. 
(Ord. No. 90-41 § 1, 09-20-90) 
Section 14-115 - Dropping litter from aircraft. 
No person in an aircraft shall throw out, drop, or deposit within the City any litter, handbill, or any other object. 
(Ord. No. 90-41 § 1, 09-20-90) 
Section 14-116 - Posting notices prohibited. 
No person shall post or affix any notice, poster, or other paper or device calculated to attract the attention of the public to any lamppost, public utility pole, tree, or upon any public structure or building, except as may be authorized or required by law. 
(Ord. No. 90-41 § 1, 09-20-90) 
Section 14-117 - Litter on occupied private property. 
No person shall throw, deposit, or maintain litter on any occupied private property within the City, whether owned by such person or not, except that the owner or person in control of private property may maintain authorized private receptacles for collection in such a manner that litter will be prevented from being carried or deposited by the elements upon any street, sidewalk or other public place or upon any private property. Private receptacles for refuse must be stored so as not to be visible from the street except upon the day of City refuse collection. Notwithstanding the foregoing, a private receptacle behind the home is permissible although visible to a street behind the residence. 
(Ord. No. 90-41 § 1, 09-20-90) 
Section 14-118 - Owner to maintain premises free of litter. 
The owner or person in control of any private property shall at all times maintain the premises free of litter. It shall be unlawful to place rubbish including, but not limited to, appliances, air conditioners, and other items listed in Code § 14-14 and Code § 14-15, outside or beside dumpsters and other garbage containers. As provided in Code § 14-14 and Code § 14-15, it shall be unlawful to place the rubbish listed therein in a public receptacle or garbage container served by the Solid Waste Department; provided, however, that this section shall not prohibit the storage of litter in authorized private receptacles for collection. 
(Ord. No. 90-41 § 1, 09-20-90) 
Section 14-119 - Litter on vacant lots. 
No person shall throw or deposit litter on any open or vacant private property within the City whether owned by such person or not. 
(Ord. No. 90-41 § 1, 09-20-90) 
Section 14-120 - Refuse from dogs, cats, and domestic fowl. 
(A)  It shall be unlawful for the owners of dogs, cats, domestic fowl, and other domestic animals to fail to dispose of the excrement, waste, or refuse matter, resulting in odor to the occupants of adjacent property or any health hazard to the public or inhabitants of the subject premises. This same requirement applies to persons who maintain or board animals for others. 
(B)  It shall be unlawful for any person to maintain more than four dogs on a lot of record containing less than two acres unless same is (1) a licensed kennel, (2) veterinary office or (3) granted a special use permit by the Board of Zoning Appeals and the premises pass unannounced inspections by the Building and Codes Department. However, this paragraph shall not apply to puppies under four months of age. 
(C)  It shall be unlawful for any person to maintain more than six cats outdoors on a lot of record containing less than two acres unless same is a licensed kennel or veterinary office. However, this paragraph shall not apply to kittens under two months of age. 
(D)  It shall be unlawful for any person to maintain more than eight chickens, ducks, turkeys, geese, or other domestic fowl, rabbits, or any combination thereof on a lot of record containing less than two acres. 
(E)  It shall be unlawful for any person to permit their dog or cat to defecate on the sidewalk, public street, public property, or the private property of another and fail to promptly remove same. 
(F)  The procedure for special permits under Code § 14-120(B)(3) shall be the same as that provided in sections 8 and 9 of the City of Murfreesboro Zoning Ordinance, as amended, which is incorporated herein by reference as if set forth verbatim. The fee shall be the same as that established for variance requests. The Board of Zoning Appeals may grant special permit under Code § 14-120(B)(3) provided the evidence presented at the public hearing establishes the following: 
(1)  the requested use will not have a substantial or undue adverse effect upon the use and enjoyment of contiguous property and the character of the neighborhood; 
(2)  the facilities for keeping dogs will be constructed, arranged, and operated so as to be compatible with property in the immediate vicinity and not interfere with the use and enjoyment of adjacent property; and, 
(3)  the keeping of dogs will not cause offensive odors, dust, flies, insects, excessive noise, or other conditions which are detrimental to the health, safety, welfare, and enjoyment of the owners and occupants of the subject property, contiguous property, or the community as a whole. 
(G)  The Board of Zoning Appeals may impose such conditions upon the premises granted a special permit as may be necessary to prevent or minimize any adverse effects of such use and to ensure the compatibility of the use with contiguous property and property in the vicinity. Such conditions shall be set forth in the motion authorizing the permit and in the special permit. A violation of such condition shall be a violation of this chapter. The Board of Zoning Appeals is authorized to revoke a permit granted under this section if the conditions imposed upon the premises benefited by such a permit have been violated or have not been met. The holder of a special permit shall be entitled to a due process hearing prior to revocation. 
(Ord. No. 90-41 § 1, 09-20-90; Ord. No. 91-1 § 1, 01-17-91) 
Cross reference- Ch. 5, animals and fowl. 
Section 14-121 - Clearing of litter from open private property of City. 
The Codes Enforcement Officer is hereby authorized and empowered to notify the owner of any open or vacant private property within the City or the agent of such owner to properly dispose of litter located on such owner's property which is dangerous to public health, safety or welfare. The procedure, notice, hearing rights, and corrective steps set forth in Code §§ 14-55-14-57 are incorporated herein by reference. 
(Ord. No. 90-41 § 1, 09-20-90) 
Section 14-122 - Penalty. 
A violation of any of the provisions in Code §§ 14-101-14-121 shall be punishable as provided in Code § 1-8. 
(Ord. No. 90-41 § 1, 09-20-90) 
Sections 14-123-14-200 - Reserved. 
ARTICLE IV. - RECYCLING 

Section 14-201 - Recycle Murfreesboro. 
This article shall be known as the "Recycle Murfreesboro Ordinance". 
(Ord. No. 90-13 § 1, 03-22-90) 
Section 14-202 - Purposes. 
The purpose of the Recycle Murfreesboro Ordinance is to provide flexibility in developing and implementing recycling plans in the City, a means to protect our environment, a means to prolong the life of landfills, a means to preserve our natural resources, a means to prevent waste, and an alternative means of disposing of refuse. 
(Ord. No. 90-13 § 1, 03-22-90) 
Section 14-203 - Materials. 
The recycling program may include any or all of the following materials: clear, brown, and green glass bottles and jars; steel and aluminum cans; paper; plastic bottles; and, yard wastes. 
(Ord. No. 90-13 § 1, 03-22-90) 
Section 14-204 - Authority. 
The City Manager is authorized and directed to cooperate with public and not-for-profit organizations, corporations (private, for-profit), and individuals in developing recycling plans for the City, subject to the terms and provisions of this article. Any plan developed by the City Manager in cooperation with any public or private organization, corporation, or individual shall be subject to the approval of the Council after a public hearing has been advertised a minimum of ten days in a local newspaper. Copies of the plan will be available at City Hall for inspection and review by the public for a minimum of ten days prior to the public hearing. The Council may alter or amend the plan following the public hearing. A plan may be approved by resolution. When applicable, all requirements for the grant of a franchise must be satisfied. 
(Ord. No. 90-13 § 1, 03-22-90) 
Section 14-205 - Dropoff centers. 
(A)  The recycling plan may involve dropoff centers. The dropoff centers plan may involve an exclusive franchise for a portion or all of the City. The plan may permit the use of City property (such as City schools or fire halls) for collections points. The plan may involve the City actually providing the collection containers. The plan may provide an exclusive franchise for all existing and new dropoff centers within the designated territory for a designated period of time. Any such plan must address the matter of cleanup, maintenance, publicity, and regular collection of recyclable materials. The plan should address the availability of a market for the recyclable materials collected. 
(B)  If there is no existing franchise, and there are two or more applicants for the same franchise, a not-for-profit organization will be favored over a for-profit organization or individual, all other things being equal. If a for-profit organization or individual has an existing franchise, then it will have priority over all other applicants for the same franchise, provided all other things are equal. 
(Ord. No. 90-13 § 1, 03-22-90) 
Section 14-206 - Curbside collection. 
The plan may involve curbside collection of recyclable materials. The plan may provide for a central collection point one day a month at one location in each block in the franchise territory. The plan may involve City equipment and employees actually picking up and hauling the recyclable materials to a central dropoff point. The plan may provide the exclusive rights to curbside pickup in the designated area of the City for a definite period of time. Before such a plan is implemented, proof of public acceptance and willingness to voluntarily participate in the plan for curbside pickup of recyclable materials must be demonstrated by the applicant. The factors set forth in Code § 14-205(A) in evaluating and reviewing plans and applicants are incorporated herein by reference. The priorities set forth in Code § 14-205(B) are incorporated by reference. 
(Ord. No. 90-13 § 1, 03-22-90) 
Section 14-207 - Buy-back centers. 
Nothing in this article shall limit or prevent the establishment of commercial buy-back centers. In other words, an exclusive grant of franchise under this article which involves voluntary recycling will not in any way impair, impede, or limit the ability of free enterprise to establish a buy-back center. 
(Ord. No. 90-13 § 1, 03-22-90) 
Section 14-208 - Anti theft and anti-scavenger provision. 
It shall be unlawful for any person to steal or to rummage through materials involved in a recycling program. It shall be unlawful for any person to steal materials or rummage through refuse, whether involved in a voluntary recycle program or not, when the refuse is placed at the curb for collection. 
(Ord. No. 90-13 § 1, 03-22-90) 
Section 14-209 - Non-recyclable material. 
It shall be unlawful for any person to deposit trash, refuse, garbage, or rubbish at a Recycle Murfreesboro collection point which is not a recyclable material designated for collection at the Recycle Murfreesboro collection point. 
(Ord. No. 90-13 § 1, 03-22-90) 
Section 14-210 - Penalty. 
A violation of any of the provisions in Code § 14-208 or Code § 14-209 shall be punishable as provided in Code § 1-8. 
(Ord. No. 90-13 § 1, 03-22-90) 
Chapter 15 - GAS[1]

ARTICLE I. - GAS PERMITS, INSPECTIONS, AND FEES 

Section 15-1 - International Fuel Gas Code-Adopted. 
All construction, installation, alteration, replacement, enlargement, repairs, and maintenance of fuel gas systems and system components within the City, except those located in one and two-family dwellings and multiple single-family dwellings (townhouses) not more than three stories high with separate means of egress and their accessory structures, shall comply with the provisions of the 2018 International Fuel Gas Code, published by the International Code Council, one copy of which has been filed and remains on file in the office of the City Recorder, which is hereby adopted and approved and incorporated into this chapter as fully and effectually as if set out at length herein, except as specifically amended, modified, or deleted in this chapter. All construction, installation, alteration, replacement, enlargement, repairs, and maintenance of fuel gas systems and system components located in one and two-family dwellings and multiple single-family dwellings (townhouses) not more than three stories high with separate means of egress and their accessory structures shall comply with the provisions of the International Residential Code, as adopted and approved and incorporated into this chapter. 
(Ord. of 07-16-59 § 1; Ord. No. 99-O-21 § 1, 05-27-99; Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 2, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-52 § 1, 09-16-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99; Ord. No. 01-O-79 § 1, 01-10-02; Ord. No. 07-O-07 § 1, 02-08-07; Ord. No. 13-O-59 § 12, 01-16-14; Ord. No. 18-O-71 , § 12, 1-17-19) 
Section 15-2 - International Fuel Gas Code-Amended. 
    The International Fuel Gas Code is hereby specifically amended, modified, or deleted as follows: 
(A)  Section 101.1 is amended by deleting the phrase "[name of jurisdiction]" and substituting in lieu thereof the phrase "the City of Murfreesboro, Tennessee." 
(B)  Section 103.1 on creating a department of fuel gas inspection is amended by deleting the phrase "department of fuel gas inspection" and substituting in lieu thereof the phrase "Building and Codes Department." 
(C)  Section 104.4 on inspections is amended by adding the following to the end of this section: "Inspection of a gas equipment or appliance change out with like equipment or appliance having the same input BTU rating that is performed by a gas contractor licensed with the City of Murfreesboro is not required." 
(D)  Section 106.2 on work exempt from permits is hereby amended by adding two exemptions that shall read as follows: 
"3.  Replacement of any like gas appliance or equipment with the same input BTU rating when work is performed by a gas contractor licensed with the City of Murfreesboro. 
4.  Emergency repairs may be performed at night, or weekends and holidays, and during a natural disaster without first obtaining a permit. However, a permit must be obtained within the next two working days, unless the type of work performed is exempt from permits." 
(E)  Section 106.6.1 on work commencing before permit issuance is amended by deleting the phrase "subject to an additional fee established by the code official, which shall be in addition to the required permit fees" and in lieu thereof substituting the following: "required to pay two times the established fee for the required permit. The Chief Building Official may waive the doubling of the established fee where the contractor or other person applying for the permit demonstrates good cause for the failure to obtain the required permit before commencing work." 
(F)  Section 106.6.2 on schedule of permit fees is amended by deleting the text of this section in its entirety and in lieu thereof substituting the following: "Permit fees shall be set by the City Council." 
(G)  Section 106.6.3 on refunds is amended by deleting the text of this section in its entirety and in lieu thereof substituting the following: "The City Council shall adopt a policy governing the refunding of permit fees." 
(H)  Section 109 on means of appeals amended by deleting the text of this section in its entirety and in lieu thereof substituting the following: "The Construction Board of Adjustments and Appeals for the City of Murfreesboro shall have the authority to hear and decide appeals of any order, decision, or determination made by the Chief Building Official relative to the application and interpretation of this code, in accordance with the procedures set forth in Section 7-16 of the Murfreesboro City Code." 
(I)  Section 623 on cooking appliances is amended by adding a new section that shall read as follows: 
"623.8 Commercial cooking appliance safeguard devices. All commercial gas-fired cooking equipment, new or used, must be equipped with a flame safeguard device that shall automatically shut off the fuel supply to a main burner or group of burners when the means of ignition of such burners becomes inoperable." 
(Ord. of 07-16-59 § 2; Ord. of 02-10-67 § 1; Ord. No. 86-39 § 1, 10-09-86; Ord. No. 91-5 § 1, 01-24-91; Ord. No. 96-O-03 § 1, 03-28-96; Ord. No. 99-O-21 § 2, 05-27-99; Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 2, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-52 § 1, 09-16-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99; Ord. No. 01-O-26 § 4, 06-07-01; Ord. No. 01-O-79 § 2, 01-10-02; Ord. No. 13-O-59 § 12, 01-16-14; Ord. No. 18-O-71 , § 12, 1-17-19) 
Section 15-3 - Reserved. 
Section 15-4 - Commencement of gas service. 
No person, firm, or corporation, except the gas utility or supplier of gas, shall turn gas into any new or altered gas piping system or gas appliances. 
Any appliance now connected to a gas piping system that does not meet the minimum standards of the gas code of the City hereinabove approved, adopted, and incorporated into this chapter may not be disconnected and be reconnected without first meeting said standards of said gas code. 
The gas utility shall refuse gas service to and shall not turn gas into any new or altered gas piping system or gas appliance that is not constructed, reconstructed or installed in compliance with the provision(s) of the manuals or gas code adopted, approved, and made a part of this chapter. 
The gas utility shall not be responsible or held liable for any cost, expense, or damage resulting from refusal to commence gas service or to turn gas into any new or altered gas piping system or gas appliance when inspection determines that such new or altered gas piping system or gas appliance does not conform to the provisions and requirements of said manuals or gas code. 
(Ord. of 07-16-59 § 4; Ord. of 02-10-67 § 3; Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 2, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99) 
Section 15-5 - Penalty. 
Any person, as defined in Code § 1-2, who shall violate a provision of the manuals or gas code as amended or modified by Code § 15-3, adopted, approved, and incorporated into this chapter by Code § 15-2, or who shall fail to comply therewith, or with any of the provisions or requirements thereof, shall be punishable as provided in Code § 1-8. Each such person shall be deemed guilty of a separate offense, punishable as such, for each and every day or portion thereof during which any such violation or failure to comply shall continue. 
(Ord. of 02-10-67 § 4; Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 2, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99) 
ARTICLE II. - BOARD OF GAS EXAMINERS 

Section 15-6 - Purpose of regulations. 
In the interests of the public health, safety, and welfare, the following provisions establishing the Board of Gas Examiners for the licensing and regulation of those engaged in installing, replacing, or repairing natural and liquid petroleum consumer gas (hereinafter referred to as "gas") piping, venting, appliances, or equipment are adopted. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99) 
Section 15-7 - Liabilities not affected. 
This article shall not be construed to lessen the responsibility or liability of any party owning, operating, controlling, or installing any consumer gas piping, venting, appliances, or equipment for damage to persons or property caused by any defect therein, nor shall the City be held to assume liability by reason of the examination authorized herein or the license and certificate issued as herein provided. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99) 
Section 15-8 - Violations, penalty. 
Any person, firm, limited liability company, or corporation who violates any of the provisions of this Code §§ 15-6-15-37 shall pay a fine of $50.00 per day as assessed or levied by the Board of Gas Examiners. Each day constitutes a separate offense. Any person who fails to pay the fine levied by the Board will be ineligible for any new permits so long as the fine is outstanding. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99) 
Section 15-9 - Board created. 
There is hereby created and established a Board of Gas Examiners. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99) 
Section 15-10 - Composition. 
The Board of Gas Examiners shall consist of seven members to be appointed by the Mayor and confirmed by the Council. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99; Ord. No. 09-O-40 § 1, 01-14-10) 
Section 15-11 - Member term of office. 
Members of the Board of Gas Examiners shall hold office for a term of four years and until their successors are elected. The initial Board shall be appointed so the terms will be staggered (two members for one year; two members for two years; two members for three years; and three members for four years). However, a term shall end if the member's appointment is associated with the member's employment and the employment ends. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99) 
Section 15-12 - Qualifications of members. 
The members of the Board of Gas Examiners shall consist of: 
(A)  one representative of a natural gas utility company; 
(B)  one representative of a liquefied petroleum gas company; 
(C)  deleted; 
(D)  deleted; 
(E)  one heating and air conditioning contractor licensed by the City as an electrical contractor and as a gas contractor; 
(F)  one plumbing contractor licensed by the City as a gas contractor; 
(G)  two gas contractor licensed by the City as gas contractors; and, 
(H)  one citizen associated with the retail sales of gas appliances. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99; Ord. No. 09-O-40 § 2, 01-14-10) 
Section 15-13 - Chair term of office. 
The Board of Gas Examiners shall select from its membership one member to serve as chair for one year or until a successor is elected by the Board. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99) 
Section 15-14 - Removal from office; compensation; quorum. 
Any members of the Board of Gas Examiners may be removed for good cause, or for failure to attend three consecutive meetings without good reason, by Council after ten days written notice. Members of the Board of Gas Examiners shall serve without compensation. A majority shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of business. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99) 
Section 15-15 - Rules and regulations. 
The Board of Gas Examiners may promulgate rules and regulations consistent with this article, and in such event shall have such rules and regulations printed for distribution. Such rules and regulations must be approved by the Mayor and City Council. Rules and regulations may include requirements that gas contractors furnish proof of financial responsibility. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99) 
Section 15-16 - Regular meetings. 
The Board of Gas Examiners shall hold meetings on the first Wednesday in February, May, August, and November. During its meetings, the Board shall: 
(A)  review qualifications of applicants for a Class I or Class II license as set forth in Code § 15-19; 
(B)  determine the general qualifications and fitness of each applicant for executing the class of work covered by the license requested; 
(C)  issue licenses and certificates therefore; and, 
(D)  conduct such other business as may properly come before the Board. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99; Ord. No. 02-O-18 § 1, 08-15-02) 
Section 15-17 - Special meetings. 
Special meetings of the Board of Gas Examiners may be called by the chair or any two members. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99) 
Section 15-18 - Records. 
Records of the meetings of the Board of Gas Examiners, including the names of all licensees, shall be open for inspection by the public at all reasonable times. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99) 
Section 15-19 - Application for examination; qualifications. 
(A)  Applications for examination. All persons now or hereafter desiring to engage in installing, replacing, or repairing consumer gas piping, venting, appliances, or equipment in the City, either as Class I commercial gas contractor or Class II residential gas contractor, shall apply in writing to the Board of Gas Examiners to take the applicable examination, as specified in this article. Said application must be completed and returned to the Board with a proper application fee and documentation ten days prior to the meeting date. The applicant shall appear before the Board for examination for the particular license requested. Examinations for Class I commercial gas contractor and Class II residential gas contractor shall be written and shall be different, reasonable, and especially thorough, so as to obtain from the applicant an understanding of the extent of the applicant's knowledge of gas work and laws encompassed by the requested classification. 
(B)  Qualifications of Class I commercial gas contractors. 
(1)  Has had three or more years practical experience as a registered journeyman gas installer in the City in Class I commercial work within the last five years; 
(2)  Has had two or more years experience as a licensed Class II residential gas contractor in the City within the last five years; 
(3)  Has had three or more years experience in gas piping and venting in commercial or industrial installations or such education and practical experience as may be determined by the Board of Gas Examiners to be the equivalent of three years experience which shall include not less than two years practical experience in commercial or industrial installations within the last five years; or, 
(4)  Has held a plumbing or HVAC contractor license with the State of Tennessee for two or more years which has not been revoked or suspended within the last ten years. 
(C)  Qualifications for a Class II residential gas contractor. 
(1)  Two or more years experience as a registered journeyman gas installer in the City within the last five years; 
(2)  Has previously held a Class II residential gas contractor license in the City, which was not revoked or suspended, within the last five years; 
(3)  Degree in gas/mechanical engineering or technology from an accredited school and one year of practical experience within the last five years; or, 
(4)  Two years practical experience in residential gas piping and venting, as shall be deemed equivalent by the Board of Gas Examiners, within the last five years. 
(D)  Proof of qualifications. The Board of Gas Examiners shall require written proof of any of the above qualifications, and it shall be the responsibility of the applicant to provide such definite proof with the application. 
(E)  A person who is licensed by the State of Tennessee with a MC-C Classification will be issued a Class I or Class II license upon presenting proof of their valid state license and payment of licensing fees. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99; Ord. No. 02-O-18 §§ 2, 3, 08-15-02; Ord. No. 09-O-40 § 3, 01-14-10) 
Section 15-20 - Passing examinations; issuance of license. 
Any applicant making a grade of 80% or more on the written examination shall be considered qualified and the Board of Gas Examiners shall issue to the applicant a license upon payment of the required fees and submission of all required information. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99) 
Section 15-21 - Application fee. 
An application fee in the following amounts shall accompany the application for examination: 
Class I commercial gas contractor application fee ..... $100.00 
Class II residential gas contractor application fee ..... $50.00 
The applicant shall pay the required examination fee to the testing agency. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99; Ord. No. 02-O-18 § 4, 08-15-02) 
Section 15-22 - Qualifications for a journeyman gas installer. 
Any person shall be eligible for registration as a journeyman gas installer who has a letter of recommendation from the license holder with whom the applicant is employed. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99) 
Section 15-23 - License and registration fees. 
Fees for license and registration granted, renewed, or reestablished with a new company shall be paid on or before October 1 st of each year or at the time of new company listing, with no provision for probation of a partial year. The fees are as follows: 
Class I commercial gas contractor license fee ..... $100.00 
Class II residential gas contractor license fee ..... $50.00 
Journeyman gas installer registration fee ..... $10.00 
Any applicant failing to pay the license fee within 30 days of the report of the examination score shall pay an additional $50.00. If the applicant fails to pay the license fee after 60 days, the applicant shall pay an additional $100.00 rather than $50.00 and appear before the Board of Gas Examiners prior to the issuance of a license. If the applicant fails to show good and reasonable cause for failure to make timely payment, the applicant shall be required to retake the examination and pay all the fees associated therewith. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99) 
Section 15-24 - License required; exceptions. 
(A)  No person, firm, limited liability company, or corporation shall engage in installing, replacing, repairing gas piping, venting, appliances, or equipment in the City or holds themselves out as being in the business of installing, replacing, repairing gas piping, venting, appliances, or equipment in the City unless such person has received a gas license of the appropriate class and a certificate therefore; or in the case of a firm, limited liability company, or corporation, unless it is owned or operated by, or has in its regular employment, a person who has received a gas license of the appropriate class and a certificate therefor. 
(B)  Exceptions. A homeowner performing work to a single-family residence in which the homeowner resides is not required to obtain a license. However, the homeowner is required to abide by all other ordinances, codes, and regulations of the City pertaining to the installation or replacement of gas piping, venting, appliances, or equipment. A person who is licensed as a Contractor by the State of Tennessee with a MC-C classification is not required to obtain a license. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99; Ord. No. 09-O-40 § 4, 01-14-10) 
Section 15-25 - Classes of licenses; limitations. 
(A)  Three classes of licenses shall be issued by the Board of Gas Examiners: 
(1)  A Class I commercial gas contractor license shall entitle the holder thereof to engage in the business of and to secure permits for the installation, alteration, replacement, and repair of any gas piping, venting, appliance, or equipment. Additionally, the holder of a Class I license is entitled to change out like appliances or equipment with the same input BTU rating without being required to obtain permits and inspections for this class of work. A Class I commercial gas contractor license shall entitle the holder thereof to perform any work listed in this article, including any Class II residential work. 
(2)  A Class II residential gas contractor license with change out exemption registration shall entitle the holder to engage in the business of and to secure permits for the installation, alteration, replacement, and repair of any gas piping, venting, appliances, or equipment in residential buildings up to four units per building not exceeding a total BTU input rating of one million. Additionally, the holder of a Class II license is entitled to change out like appliances with the same input BTU rating without being required to obtain permits and inspections for this residential class of work. The Chief Building Official may waive the requirement for an inspector to witness a gas pressure test and allow the holder of a Class II license to conduct, witness, and certify the gas pressure test. 
(3)  A special license may be issued in the discretion of the Board of Gas Examiners to relieve hardships and to permit work to continue on a temporary basis when a firm, limited liability company, or corporation loses an employee, officer, or director who holds a license, subject to concern for public safety. 
(B)  The holders of any of the three licenses specified in Code § 15-25(A) shall supervise registered journeyman gas installers; however, the license holder shall not be required to be on the site while work is being performed, provided a registered journeyman gas installer employed by the license holder is on the site at all times while work is being performed. The pressure test certification shall be on a form approved by the Building Official. 
(C)  A journeyman gas installer registration shall entitle the holder thereof to perform the installation, replacement, and repair of any gas piping, venting, appliances, or equipment under the supervision of a holder of a Class I or II license. The holder of a journeyman gas installer registration may supervise other gas installers but may not be issued permits for gas work. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99; Ord. No. 02-O-18 § 5, 08-15-02; Ord. No. 09-O-40 § 5, 01-14-10) 
Section 15-26 - Appropriate license prerequisite to doing work; exceptions. 
Where any gas work is being performed, it shall be supervised by the license holder or by a registered journeyman gas installer employed by the holder of a Class I commercial gas contractor license, Class II residential gas contractor license, or special license, and no person shall in any manner undertake to execute any work of installing, maintaining, altering, replacing, or repairing any gas piping, venting, appliances, or equipment unless such person has received either a Class I commercial gas contractor license or a Class II residential gas contractor license and a certificate therefor, provided that no license shall be required in order to execute any of the following classes of work: 
(A)  the installation, alteration, or repair of gas piping, venting, appliances, or equipment installed by or for a public service gas corporation for the use of such corporation in the generation, transmission, sale, or use of gas, or for the use of such corporation in the operation of supplying gas; 
(B)  the assembly, erection, and connection of gas appliances and equipment by the manufacturer of such appliances and equipment; and, 
(C)  the maintenance and repair of gas appliances or equipment in non-hazardous factory/industrial plants through regular employees. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99) 
Section 15-27 - Expiration of license/registration; renewal; service in the armed forces. 
Licenses and registrations issued under this article shall expire on the 30 th day of September, following the date of its issuance. All licenses and registrations shall be renewable upon application of the holder within 30 days prior to the expiration date of the license or registration upon payment of the annual fee set out in this article. Any licensee who fails to make application and pay the required fee prior to expiration will be required to pay $25.00 in addition to the ordinary license fee. Any licensee who fails to make application and pay the required fee within 30 days following the expiration date will be required to pay $50.00 in addition to the ordinary license fee and will be required to appear before the Board of Gas Examiners. The licensee may be required to take another examination by the Board unless such licensee shows good and sufficient cause for failure to make timely application for the renewal. If any licensee/registrant enters active service in the armed forces of the United States, the holder shall be granted a renewal license upon their application after discharge from such service if such application is presented to the Board within six months following the date of their discharge and the application is within five years of entering military service. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99) 
Section 15-28 - Review of renewal applications; applicant statement. 
It shall be the duty of the Board of Gas Examiners to review all applications for the renewal of any license, and the Board shall require that each applicant for renewal shall file a statement signed by the applicant that the applicant has not misused the license and that the applicant has abided by the ordinances, codes, and regulations of the City pertaining to gas contractors and the installation and replacement of gas piping, venting, appliances, or equipment. If an applicant for renewal cannot honestly file such a statement, a full explanation of the reasons must accompany the renewal application in lieu of all or part of the required statement. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99) 
Section 15-29 - Notices. 
Notices shall be considered sufficient when delivered personally to the person to whom said notice is directed or when mailed to the last known address of the applicant as shown in the records of the Board of Gas Examiners. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99) 
Section 15-30 - Licensee to supervise work under license; duties specified. 
(A)  A registered journeyman gas installer employed by the holder of the gas permit issued for the job in question, or the holder of the license, must be on site at all times while work is being performed. Registration issued in accordance with the provisions of this article shall specify the name of the person who has qualified for registration and the employer who is a holder of the license. 
(B)  The Board of Gas Examiners and the gas inspector(s) shall be notified in writing of the name of the firm with whom the registered journeyman is associated. 
(C)  Any firm, limited liability company, or corporation holding a license pursuant to Code § 15-24 must immediately notify the Board when its officer, director, or employee which holds a registration or license under this article ceases employment and the firm, limited liability company, or corporation does not have another officer, director or employee holding a license or registration under this article which would entitle the firm, limited liability company, or corporation to hold a license pursuant to Code § 15-24. The terminating employee shall also immediately notify the Board. The Board shall immediately contact the firm, limited liability company, or corporation for which the registered journeyman or license holder was employed and ascertain the current status of the bids, contracts, and permits of such firm, limited liability company, or corporation covering work to be performed in the City, and the Board may, in its discretion, relieve any hardships and permit such work on a temporary basis as deemed appropriate, with special requirements consistent with public safety. 
(D)  The license holder and registered journeyman shall be a full-time employee of the firm, limited liability company, corporation, or individual represented during normal working hours of said business. The license holder shall neither represent nor obtain permits for any other firm, limited liability company, corporation, or individual. Further, the license holder shall neither represent nor obtain permits for more than one firm, limited liability company, corporation, or individual at any one time. 
(E)  License holders may contract work to unlicensed contractors when a subcontract agreement between the general contractor and a licensed gas contractor is filed with the Board. Documentation of payment to the licensed gas contractor must be filed with the Board prior to final inspection. The license holder or a registered journeyman gas installer employed by the holder of the gas permit issued for the job in question must be on site at all times while work is being performed. 
(F)  License holders are required to report current business address, residential address, and business phone number and fax number to the Board. 
(G)  All vehicles used by a gas contractor and/or the contractor's employees primarily to transport materials and/or tools shall be properly identified while on a job site where gas work is being performed. The required information shall be conspicuously displayed in a contrasting color on both the driver and passenger sides of the vehicle. The required information may be applied to the vehicle on a temporary (e.g. magnetic sign) or permanent (e.g. paint) basis. The information required is: 
(1)  The full name of the gas contractor in lettering at least three inches high; or 
(2)  The Murfreesboro, Tennessee Gas Contractor's license number in lettering at least two inches high with the wording "Murfreesboro, Tennessee" in lettering at least two inches high. 
(H)  Subsection 15(G)(2) may be abbreviated as "M'Boro, TN, Gas Lic. # [number]." 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99; Ord. No. 01-O-41 § 2, 09-06-01) 
Section 15-31 - Registration and license to be available for inspection. 
Every holder of any license or registration issued under this article will also be issued a license card or registration card annually with license or registration renewal which shall be carried at all times while engaged in any gas work and shown upon request of any gas inspector or other duly authorized person having responsibility for enforcing this article. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99) 
Section 15-32 - Registration or license certificates not transferable. 
No license and registration issued in accordance with the provisions of this article shall be assignable or transferable. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99) 
Section 15-33 - Revocation or suspension of license or registration; revocation of certain rights; disapproval of renewal; hearing. 
(A)  The Board of Gas Examiners shall revoke or suspend a license or registration issued to any gas contractor or journeyman gas installer upon proof by a preponderance of the evidence that such person: 
(1)  knowingly violated the provisions of this chapter or the regulations of the Board; 
(2)  practiced fraud or deception in making application for or obtaining such certificate or license; 
(3)  is incompetent to perform a service to the public as certified; 
(4)  permitted their license or registration to be used, directly or indirectly, by another to obtain or perform gas work or services in violation of this chapter; 
(5)  is guilty of such other unprofessional or dishonorable conduct of such nature as to deceive or defraud the public; 
(6)  has performed gas work in excess of that permitted by the license or registration held; 
(7)  failed to comply with this chapter, the requirements of the gas code, or failed to obtain permits required before commencing work; 
(8)  obtained a permit directly or indirectly for another unless the license holder shall be the supervisor of all work covered by the permit; 
(9)  received from another any compensation wherein the sole consideration thereof is obtaining of a permit; or, 
(10)  failed to maintain insurance as required by Code § 15-35 and Code § 15-36. 
(B)  The Board of Gas Examiners may disapprove any renewal of a license or registration when the applicant has misused the license or registration, has made any intentional misstatement on said application, or has been guilty of any act of conduct which would constitute grounds for revocation or suspension of a license or registration as herein provided; however, the Board shall not disapprove any renewal until after the applicant has been accorded an opportunity to be heard after five days notice by registered mail or personal service of such a notice. 
(C)  No action of the Board of Gas Examiners to suspend or revoke a license or registration shall become final until the alleged offender has been given an opportunity to appear before the Board to show cause as to why such action should not be taken. 
(D)  Notice in writing of the proposed action of the Board to revoke or suspend a license or registration shall be given to the holder of such license or registration, stating the specific charges upon which such action is proposed. The notice shall stipulate that a hearing will be scheduled at a time and place set by the Board for the party to show cause why such action should not be made final. Such hearing shall be held not less than five days following notice to the licensee or registrant. Failure to appear before the Board to answer the specific charges set forth in the notice shall be deemed just cause for final revocation or suspension of the license or registration. 
(E)  The Board of Gas Examiners may revoke the privilege of a licensed contractor to witness and certify gas pressure tests as set forth in Code § 15-25(A)(2). 
(F)  The Board may revoke the privilege of a licensed contractor to perform like change outs without obtaining permits and inspections as set forth in Code § 15-25(A)(1) and Code § 15-25(A)(2). 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99; Ord. No. 02-O-18 § 6, 08-15-02) 
Section 15-34 - Exemption from written examination. 
All persons desiring a Class I or Class II license shall be required to take an examination. Any person who is doing business within the City as a gas contractor that: 
(A)  has held a business tax license for the purpose of operating a heating and air conditioning or plumbing business which involved installing consumer gas piping, venting, appliances or equipment, issued by the City or County for any two years between January 1, 1995 and December 1, 1999 and carried general liability insurance and was named as the insured during this two-year period; or, 
(B)  has held a Designated Dealer certificate from United Cities Gas Company for the purpose of engaging in installing consumer gas piping, venting, appliances or equipment within five years preceding the adoption of this article and has carried general liability insurance and was named as the insured for two years preceding the adoption of this article; 
shall be exempted from taking the examination required in order to hold a Class I or Class II license and shall be issued a license based on the highest class of work performed in the City or County during the appropriate exemption period specified herein, provided that such application for such license is substantiated with written proof of qualifications and insurance, and payment therefore is received within three months after the effective date of this article or the first meeting of the Board, whichever is later. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99) 
Section 15-35 - Insurance. 
No person shall receive a license unless the applicant shows proof of a certificate of liability insurance with minimum limits of $1,000,000.00 single limits for personal injuries, wrongful death, and property damages. The certificate shall remain in force so long as a license is held. Proof of insurance must be filed annually. A single insurance certificate may cover more than one licensee when they are employed by the same person, firm, limited liability company, or corporation. The insurance certificate shall require notification to the City of Murfreesboro Chief Building Official, 111 West Vine Street, Murfreesboro, TN 37130 30 days prior to termination or cancellation. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99) 
Section 15-36 - Workers' compensation insurance. 
No person shall receive a license until such person has shown proof of workers' compensation insurance. The insurance certificate shall require notification to the City of Murfreesboro Chief Building Official, 111 West Vine Street, Murfreesboro, TN 37130 30 days prior to termination or cancellation. 
(Ord. No. 99-O-46 § 1, 09-02-99; Ord. No. 99-O-60 § 1, 12-16-99) 
Section 15-37 - License placed on inactive status. 
A license holder may apply to the Board of Gas Examiners to place the license on an inactive status. After payment of an application fee of $100.00, a license holder shall appear before the Board to obtain such status. The license shall not become inactive until all work under permits obtained by the license holder has been satisfactorily completed or until all permits have been cancelled. 
No license holder on inactive status shall engage in any activity for which a license is required. Inactive licenses may be made active by submitting an application and application fee of $50.00 to the Board. The license shall be reactivated after a waiting period of 30 days from the date this application is submitted, payment of current license fees, proof of required insurance, appearance of the inactive license holder before the Board at the next regular meeting, and approval of the Board. 
(Ord. No. 02-O-18 § 7, 08-15-02) 
Chapter 17 - PROPERTY STANDARDS[1] 

Footnotes:
